A Norway rat's head will be large, stubby, short, and broad in relation to its body, while a deer mouse's head will be a triangular shape and small in comparison to its body. Deer mice also have a sharper and narrower snout and larger ears than Norway rats.

Among those that have been proven effective is bed bugs treatment by freezing.

Studies have shown that bed bugs cannot stand extreme temperatures. In fact, they die after a few seconds of being exposed to extreme heat or extreme cold. Being exposed to heat however is not very much advisable because extreme heat may cause the disintegrating of materials that make up furniture. It can also cause burning and melting of some components of household pieces.

This is why most professional pest control teams employ bed bugs treatment by freezing. It does not only get rid of the bugs, but it also preserves the furniture.

Bed bugs treatment by freezing works by exposing the infested furniture into an extremely low temperature. The temperature reaches and penetrates even the most hidden part so all the bugs are killed after a few minutes. Even those that are hiding underneath the surface are made to come out. Another good thing about it is you don't actually piss the insects so it is not as bloody and dangerous.

Keeping the furniture in a huge freezer is another way of treatment. The freezer acts to the core of the furniture so all the bugs that inhabits there do not survive. Even the eggs don't get to complete the cycles and are expelled even before they become full blown bugs. For best results, the furniture or house pieces are left in a very cold temperature for several hours.

In some parts of the country where snow comes in season, keeping beds and other things in the house that are infected outside to catch the snow coming done can also be effective. Wrapping the pieces in snow for a few hours can be very effective. This is especially advised for furniture that is made of wood and other materials beside light fabrics.

Bed bugs treatment by freezing can be executed by anyone with the proper instructions. It would however be better if made by a team that has expertise on exterminating these annoying pests. Whichever you used ensure that the manufacturers instructions are followed exactly.
